formula.name: ToHexString
formula.description: Returns the hex string representation of the binary value.

formula.name: ToHexBinary
formula.description: Returns the binary representation of the hex string.

formula.name: ToBase64String
formula.description: Returns the base64 string representation of the binary value.

formula.name: ToBase64Binary
formula.description: Returns the binary representation of the base64 string.

formula.name: ToASCIIString
formula.description: Returns the ASCII string representation of the binary value. This is equivalent to calling BinaryToString with encoding as 'ascii'.

formula.name: ToASCIIBinary
formula.description: Returns the binary representation of the ASCII string. This is equivalent to calling StringToBinary with encoding as 'ascii'.

formula.name: BinaryToString
formula.description: Converts binary data to String using the specified encoding.

formula.name: StringToBinary
formula.description: Converts string to binary data using the specified encoding.

formula.name: ToBinary
formula.description: Converts value to binary data. Supports only int and long values.

formula.name: ToBinary
formula.description: Converts value to binary data. Supports only int and long values.

formula.name: GetBinaryInt
formula.description: This function extracts a integer value from a binary object. offset - Location of the integer. length - Length of the integer. Should be one of (1,2,4). signed - specifies whether the integer is signed. bigEndian - specifies how the integer is stored.

formula.name: GetBinaryLong
formula.description: This function extracts a long value from a binary object. offset - Location of the integer. length - Length of the integer. Should be one of (1,2,4,8). signed - specifies whether the integer is signed. bigEndian - specifies how the integer is stored.

formula.name: SetBinaryInt
formula.description: This function sets a integer value in a binary object. offset - Location of the integer. length - Length of the integer. Should be one of (1,2,4). signed - specifies whether the integer is signed. bigEndian - specifies how the integer is stored.
formula.signature: SetBinaryInt(binary, value, offsetOpt, lengthOpt, signed, bigEndian)

formula.name: SetBinaryLong
formula.description: This function set6s a long value in a binary object. offset - Location of the integer. length - Length of the integer. Should be one of (1,2,4,8). signed - specifies whether the integer is signed. bigEndian - specifies how the integer is stored.
formula.signature: SetBinaryLong(binary, value, offsetOpt, lengthOpt, signed, bigEndian)

formula.name: Equal
formula.description: Returns true if the two binary values are equal (every bytes must be the same).

formula.name: NotEqual
formula.description: Returns true if the two binary values are not equal (at least one byte is different).

formula.name: Length
formula.description: Returns the length of the binary object.

formula.name: At
formula.description: Returns the byte (as int) at the specified index

formula.name: Left
formula.description: Returns the leftmost, specified no. of bytes from the Binary object.

formula.name: Right
formula.description: Returns the rightmost specified no.of bytes from a Binary object.

formula.name: Mid
formula.description: Returns the specified no.of bytes from the Binary starting from the specified start_index.

formula.name: Sub
formula.description: Returns a sub binary object (same as Mid).

formula.name: FindFirst
formula.description: Returns the index of first occurrence of a string/character in another string, searching from the index specified. If the index is not specified, searches from the beginning of the string.

formula.name: FindLast
formula.description: Returns the index of last occurrence of a string/character in another string, searching from the index specified. If the index is not specified, searches from the end of the string. The search is from right to left of the string.

formula.name: Plus
formula.description: Returns the sum of the arguments. You can also use the + operator instead.
